title: Son of former Michigan judge found guilty of dismembering him
text:
The son of a former Michigan judge has been found guilty of dismembering his father’s body, but was acquitted of killing him.

Police in Boca Raton, Fla., said parts of James “Skip” Scandirito’s body were found in March 2018 at an abandoned golf course.

On Thursday, a jury found his son, James “Jimmy” Scandirito II, 50, guilty of abuse of a corpse, according to the Associated Press. He was found not guilty of murder.

The younger Scandirito initially claimed his father, 74, was missing after not returning from a kayaking trip, but later told police he’d found the former Macomb County judge dead after an apparent cocaine overdose and panicked, the AP and The Palm Beach Post said. He later testified he’d used a saw to cut up his father’s body in his garage, then hid the pieces at a construction site and the old golf course because he was afraid.

Scandirito faces up to 15 year in prison when he is sentenced in June.

The elder Scandirito resigned from the Macomb County court bench in 2000 after sexual misconduct allegations, the AP said.

Women had accused him of offering leniency for their charges in return for sexual favors, the Palm Beach Post has reported. The state of Michigan revoked his judge’s license in 2002.
